aboutPage.title: About Daadaar
aboutPage.subtitle: A decentralized initiative for transparency and justice.
aboutPage.intro_body: Daadaar is an open-source, decentralized platform dedicated to documenting and visualizing the complex web of relationships within the Iranian government and its affiliated institutions. Our primary objective is to expose institutional injustices by providing a secure, anonymous channel for citizens to report incidents and for the global community to verify them.
aboutPage.context_body: In an environment where information is tightly controlled and transparency is non-existent, systemic corruption and human rights abuses thrive in the shadows. Daadaar aims to shine a light on these dark corners by leveraging the power of collective intelligence and modern technology. We believe that mapping the hierarchy of power is the first step towards holding it accountable.
aboutPage.how_it_works_step1_body: Users can submit reports about specific individuals or organizations without revealing their identity. Our system is designed from the ground up to protect the reporter, utilizing advanced encryption and a strict zero-logging policy.
aboutPage.how_it_works_step2_body: Every report undergoes a rigorous verification process. We employ a hybrid model that combines AI-driven analysis with trusted community moderation to ensure the accuracy and credibility of the data.
aboutPage.how_it_works_step3_body: Verified data is fed into our global knowledge graph. This allows us to visualize connections, command structures, and spheres of influence, revealing patterns that would be impossible to detect in isolated reports.
aboutPage.tech_body: Daadaar is built on a stack prioritizing security and resilience. We use a graph database to model complex relationships, IPFS for decentralized media storage, and a custom Proof-of-Work (PoW) mechanism to prevent spam without relying on invasive CAPTCHAs or IP tracking. The entire codebase is open-source, allowing security experts to audit our privacy claims.
aboutPage.privacy_body: We do not track IP addresses. We do not use browser fingerprinting. We do not store any metadata that could link a user to a submission. Anonymity is not just a feature of Daadaar; it is our foundational promise. We encourage the use of VPNs and Tor to further protect your connection.
aboutPage.join_us_body: This is a community-driven project. Whether you are a developer, a researcher, or a citizen with a story to tell, your contribution is vital. Help us build the most comprehensive map of institutional power in Iran.
aboutPage.opensource_desc: Trust requires transparency. Our code is fully open source on GitHub.

contentPolicy.title: Content Policy
contentPolicy.description: Content Policy for the Daadaar Platform
contentPolicy.purpose_body: Daadaar exists to document and visualize relationships and events related to institutional injustice. Contributions should be factual, relevant, and constructive.
contentPolicy.prohibited_intro: To maintain a safe and reliable environment, the following content is strictly prohibited:
contentPolicy.prohibited_hate_body: Content that promotes violence or hatred against individuals or groups based on race, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, age, or sexual orientation.
contentPolicy.prohibited_harassment_body: Targeting individuals for malicious abuse or doxxing (revealing private personal information not relevant to the public interest).
contentPolicy.prohibited_spam_body: Promotional content, repetitive posts, or automated gibberish.
contentPolicy.prohibited_illegal_body: Material that violates applicable laws, including child exploitation material or promotion of terrorism.
contentPolicy.verification_body: We encourage users to provide evidence for their claims. Our system uses AI and community voting to estimate the credibility of reports. Content that is debunked or lacks credible sourcing may be flagged or removed.
contentPolicy.reporting_body: If you encounter content that violates this policy, please use the "Report" feature present on every entity and report page. Our moderation team reviews these reports regularly.
contentPolicy.appeal_body: If your content has been removed or your access restricted, and you believe this was in error, you may appeal the decision through our standard support channels if you have a registered account. Anonymous temporary bans (session-based) typically expire automatically.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.description: Privacy Policy for the Daadaar Platform
privacyPolicy.commitment_body: Daadaar is built on the principle of privacy by default. We believe you should be able to expose injustice without sacrificing your anonymity. This Privacy Policy explains what information we collect, how we use it, and the steps we take to protect your identity.
privacyPolicy.zero_ip_body: We explicitly do not log or store your IP address. Our infrastructure, including our Cloudflare integration, is configured to anonymize requests at the edge.
privacyPolicy.no_tracking_body: We do not track your browsing history or personal behavior on the Platform beyond what is necessary for security (see Rate Limiting).
privacyPolicy.sessions_body: When you visit Daadaar, a random Session ID is generated and stored locally on your device. This identifier is used solely for:
privacyPolicy.sessions_list_1: Rate limiting to prevent spam (e.g., limiting the number of reports you can submit in an hour).
privacyPolicy.sessions_list_2: Managing your "upvotes" and "downvotes" to prevent double-voting.
privacyPolicy.sessions_note: This Session ID is not linked to your real-world identity.
privacyPolicy.account_intro: If you choose to create an account, we collect:
privacyPolicy.account_list_3: Email (Optional): Only if you wish to recover your account. We recommend using a secure, anonymous email provider.
privacyPolicy.submissions_body: Any reports, images, or text you submit to the Platform are public. Please be mindful of any personally identifiable information (PII) included in your submissions. We strive to sanitize content, but you are responsible for what you share.
privacyPolicy.usage_security_body: To protect the Platform from abuse, spam, and "sybil attacks" using Proof-of-Work (PoW) and rate limiting.
privacyPolicy.usage_operation_body: To display reports, verify content via AI, and maintain the knowledge graph.
privacyPolicy.cookies_intro: We use local storage and session cookies strictly for necessary functions:
privacyPolicy.cookies_list_1: Maintaining your login state or anonymous session.
privacyPolicy.cookies_note: We do not use third-party tracking cookies for advertising.
privacyPolicy.security_encryption_body: All data is encrypted in transit (HTTPS/TLS) and at rest (stored encrypted in our databases and object storage).
privacyPolicy.security_retention_body: We do not retain logs that could identify you. Rate limit keys expire automatically.
privacyPolicy.thirdparty_intro: We use trusted third-party providers for infrastructure, including:
privacyPolicy.thirdparty_cf_desc: For DDoS protection and content delivery.
privacyPolicy.thirdparty_openai_desc: For verifying report content (only the report text is sent, not metadata).
privacyPolicy.thirdparty_note: These providers are vetted to ensure they align with our security and privacy standards.
privacyPolicy.contact_updates: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of any material changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.
privacyPolicy.contact_body: If you have concerns about your privacy, please contact the administrators via the Platform's reporting channels.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.description: Terms of Service for the Daadaar Platform
terms.intro_body: Welcome to Daadaar ("the Platform"). By accessing or using our website, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. Daadaar is a decentralized, anonymous platform designed to expose institutional injustices through community-driven reporting.
terms.anonymous_body: We prioritize your privacy and anonymity. You may use the Platform without registering an account ("Anonymous User"). However, to ensure the integrity of the Platform, we employ Proof-of-Work (PoW) mechanisms and session-based rate limiting. By using the Platform, you consent to these security measures.
terms.responsibilities_intro: You are solely responsible for the content you submit, including reports, votes, and media. You agree not to submit content that:
terms.resp_ip: Infringes on the intellectual property rights of others.
terms.resp_spam: Contains spam, malware, or malicious code.
terms.resp_harass: Is intended to harass, bully, or harm individuals.
terms.moderation_body: While we strive for a censorship-resistant platform, we reserve the right to remove content and ban users (via Session ID or User ID) that violate these Terms or our Content Policy. This includes, but is not limited to, spam, hate speech, and verifiably false information. Moderators and Admins have the authority to review flagged content and take appropriate action.
terms.disclaimer_body: The Platform is provided "as is" and "as available" without any warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or reliability of any user-generated content. The verification scores provided by our AI systems are estimates and should not be taken as absolute truth.
terms.liability_body: To the fullest extent permitted by law, Daadaar and its operators shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages, or any loss of profits or revenues, whether incurred directly or indirectly, or any loss of data, use, goodwill, or other intangible losses, resulting from your access to or use of or inability to access or use the Platform.
terms.changes_body: We may modify these Terms at any time. We will provide notice of significant changes by updating the "Last updated" date at the top of this page. Your continued use of the Platform signifies your acceptance of the modification.
terms.governing_body: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which the Platform operates, without regard to its conflict of law provisions.
terms.contact_body: If you have any questions about these Terms, please contact us through the available channels on the Platform.
